ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Visit name
Actual number of months from Baseline
Days since baseline
Number of oral antipsychotic meds currently prescribed
First oral antipsychotic med currently prescribed
Generic name of medication name provided
Generic medication WHO drug code
ETP Medication Classification Code
Prescribed number of pills to take daily
In past month, number of days med not taken
In past month, number of days took fewer than prescribed dose
Second oral antipsychotic med currently prescribed
Generic name of medication name provided
Generic medication WHO drug code
ETP Medication Classification Code
Prescribed number of pills to take daily
In past month, number of days med not taken
In past month, number of days took fewer than prescribed dose
In past month, number of pills supposed to be taken
In past month, number of pills that were missed
In the past 7 days did you take your regular stimulants?
Notes: 1= Yes; 2= No; 3= NA not taking regular stimulants; 88= Missing; 77= Refused;

ElementDescription: In the past 7 days did you take your regular stimulants. If no, how many did you miss?
In the past 7 days, did you take any as needed medications for psychiatric conditions?
Notes: 1= Yes; 2= No; 3= NA not taking as needed meds; 88= Missing; 77= Refused;

ElementDescription: In the past 7 days, did you take any as needed medications for psychiatric conditions. If yes, how many doses did you take?
Number of days covered by ADHD stimulant medication
Total number of days during time period
Proportion of days covered by ADHD stimulant medication
Timepoint/visit label
Month of the interview
Medication type
Are you currently prescribed [med_type]?
Over the past week, have you taken the medication(s) as prescribed?
Notes: 0 = Yes; 1 = No, I missed 1-2 days; 2 =  No, I missed several days; 3 = No, I haven''t taken the medication at all; 4 = No, I  am taking a different dose than I was prescribe; 5 = Don''t know;9 = Missing

ElementDescription: Why didn''t you take the medication(s) as prescribed?
Notes: 0 = I felt better; 1 = I don''t need it any more; 2 = I don''t like taking medications; 3 = I don''t like how it makes me feel; 4 = I do not have the medication yet; 6 = I forgot to take the medication; 7 = Other reason; 9 = Missing

ElementDescription: Other reason(s) for why you did not take the medication(s) as prescribed
Over the past 7 days, how bothered were you by headaches related to your medication?
Notes: 0 = No headaches; 1 = Mild or very mild headaches; 2 = Moderate headaches which did not interfere with your daily life; 3 = Pronounced headaches interfering with your daily life; 9 = Missing

ElementDescription: Over the past 7 days, how bothered were you by nausea or vomiting related to your medication?
Notes: 0 = No nausea; 1 = Mild or very mild nausea; 2 = Disturbing nausea, but without vomiting; 3 = Any vomiting; 9 = Missing

ElementDescription: Over the past 7 days, how bothered were you by diarrhea related to your medication?
Notes: 0 = No diarrhea; 1 = Clearly present, but did not disturb work or other performance; 2 = Disturbing, resulted in interruptions of work; 9 = Missing

ElementDescription: Over the past 7 days, how bothered were you by constipation related to your medication?
Notes: 0 = No constipation; 1 = Clearly present, but did not disturb work or other performance; 2 = Disturbing, resulted in interruptions of work; 9 = Missing

ElementDescription: Over the past 7 days, how bothered were you by sexual dysfunction related to your medication?
Notes: 0 = No sexual dysfunction; 1 = Mild severity, did not cause any disability; 2 = Moderate severity and mildly disabling; 3 = Severe and/or caused significant disability; 9 = Missing

ElementDescription: Over the past 7 days, have you experienced any other side effects related to your medication?
Please describe the other side effect(s)
Notes: 1 = Very mild, did not cause any disability; 2 = Mild severity, did not cause any disability; 3 = Moderate severity and mildly disabling; 4 = Severe and/or caused significant disability; 9 = Missing

ElementDescription: Other Side Effects Describe
Clinician assessment of impact of study intervention on patient''s medication adherence
Notes: 1= Very much improved medication adherence; 2= Improved; 3= No change; 4= Worse; 5= Very much worse; 6= Unknown; 7= Not applicable

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
